DataElement.preferredName: Bowel Patient Questionnaire Confusion Assessment Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the confusion or lack of comprehension about the question text or presentation of quality of life evaluation of an individual to evaluate the function of the digestive tract with regard to symptoms of increase in occurrences of passing stool from the rectum.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the confusion or lack of comprehension about the question text or presentation of quality of life evaluation of an individual to evaluate the function of the digestive tract with regard to symptoms of increase in occurrences of passing stool from the rectum.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (in-TES-tin) The long, tube-shaped organ in the abdomen that completes the process of digestion. There is both a large intestine and a small intestine. Also called the bowel.:A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the gastrointestinal tract between the stomach and the anus. It includes the small intestine and large intestine.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.:Confusion; a mental state characterized by a lack of clear and orderly thought and behavior.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A mental state characterized by a lack of clear and orderly thought and behavior.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the specified free-text field related to quality of life.
